8.11.19  7:37 pm   is it such a bad thing to stay in bed until 5 pm? people say that it is bad to do that or that it is a sign of depression and stuff. 

      it all depends on when you went to bed. if you went to bed at 9:00 am, i'd say it would be very important to stay in bed and asleep until about 5pm. if you went to bed at 2pm, i'd recommend sleeping for a bit longer still

8.11.19  6:14 pm   hi bill i have a specific voicing issue i thought you could help. I'm playing this: https://i.imgur.com/qZVTEaU.jpg
The last chord feels muddy to me but thin with any note less and I can't figure out if my only choice is to lower the bass notes one octave. I am not quite sure yet but i think ive pinpointed my issue with that last voicing to be the 2 fs interacting weridly with each other or the low f with the  creating weird harmonics. 

      it's just gonna depend on the sound of the instrument you're using. i don't know any greater context of the song you're in, and this may give you a warmer sound for that last chord which may or may not be what you're looking for, but might i suggest swapping the higher F out for A. but that might totally go against what you're looking for, and i think it's more likely that you just wanna finesse the instruments a bit more. try a diff instrument, try combining 2 instruments, seeing which notes you can play louder or softer on each instrument and blend it differently. maybe actually just take out that higher F. and if you want more density you could go for the A, which again will be more of a warm and cuddly sound which may or may not be what you want

8.11.19  3:48 pm   Any tips/rules of thumb for voicing non-diatonic passing chords and/or temporary key changes to make them really uh....good? 

      it's all about songs. get to know songs like people, make friends with each one of them. These things you're talking about, it's just the same as traits in people. you never know what might make someone the magical person they are. but the more people you know, the more you might be able to dream up and invent these things in song, seemingly out of nowhere

8.11.19  3:10 pm   hello bill, i was wondering, did you just start using/experimenting with blender (3d)? your latest reality video gave me that impression.

      i started experimenting with blender 3 years ago when i was looking for ways to do the 3d globe in history of the world. i abruptly abandoned it due to what i perceived to be catastrophic file management tactics, and moved onto a different and more obscure 3d program which has been my go-to for the last 3 years. as of the last 2 months i am experimenting with a huge range of different tools, but none of which has made it into any reality video yet

8.11.19  5:14 am   i am trying to teach someone singing but they usually cant control not gliding from below into the note, i havent been able to figure out the right advice to help them control it. Do you have any advice to be able to control it as opposed doing that kind of pitchbend approach from below at specific moments  naturally. Happens more when trying to work on songs that they've been singing it that way for years.

     the question i would ask is, do they want to stop doing it, or is this something you want them to do

8.11.19  3:45 am   often times when explaining myself i feel like either people dont get what im saying or dont want to hear it, but that just makes me want to explain it further, entering a feedback loop of me wanting to make sure they understand, and them really not wanting to listen or thinking they got it already while I think maybe theres a deeper way to get it. Whats a good way to get over the feeling of having to explain up until the point one is convinced the other has heard to instead be able to get over it and move on. It can even be when giving advice, that maybe the other person doesn't want to hear or is not receiving well, i find that the need to give the advice can be more harmful than the advice itself since it can make the other person feel like they have a bigger problem than they do, or feel like they have emotional homework now having had pointed stuff out. How to know when one wants the advice vs not wanting it. How to stop going in circles when gi ving adv ice and not being cued of the fact that they get it, i dont even know what im trying to ask anymore. Funnily enough whenever I get in my head and find a new problem or solution I feel like you might relate to it and have insight. Looking forward to enjoying whatever it is you're releasing next!

      you could try getting onto some kind of obstacle course. suddenly you may learn to express all your most important ideas in 3 words or less
